channel.title: CentOS on Tech Shinobi
channel.description: Recent content in CentOS on Tech Shinobi

item.title: Self-hosting RustDesk Server via Docker Compose
item.description:
RustDesk is my favorite remote desktop alternative to closed-source solutions, such as TeamViewer and Anydesk. It’s kinda like Bitwarden in the post-breach era of the LastPass/1Password market.

As a light user of RustDesk, I use it at a frequency like once per month. So I didn’t set up my own server on my VPS even though I suppose to.

For some reason, one of my RustDesk client got network blocked to the official servers. So now I have enough reason to properly doing it.
